business.headline: 'Mango Millionaire' authors Radhika Gupta, Niranjan Avasthi on SIPs, investing and moreIn this exclusive Q&A interaction, Gupta and Avasthi reflect on the core ideas in their book, the pitfalls of social media-driven investing, why SIPs still matter, and what India needs to change in the way it talks about money and long-term wealth.

Buying Dubai property with credit cards? Why many Indians are now in troubleSeveral homebuyers either clicked on payment links shared by Dubai-based builders or swiped their credit cards during their visits to the UAE. It felt hassle-free, no paperwork, no visits to the bank. But there's a catch. Read here to know more.

HCLTech CEO earned Rs 95 crore: Here are India's highest-paid IT bossesHCLTech also reported a 17.6% increase in the median pay for its employees during the financial year. HCLTech currently has 1,67,316 permanent employees.

Dehlivery shares rally up to 5% after Q1 results. Should you buy?Delhivery shares jumped 5% in early trade after the company posted its Q1FY26 results. Should you buy into the rally or wait and watch how the integration and margins play out?

Sri Lotus Developers IPO allotment today: Check your status, GMP, listing dateThe IPO of Sri Lotus Developers received a strong response during its three-day bidding window, with total subscriptions reaching 74.10 times.

Explained: How Trump's tariffs are hurting the US economyWith inflation rising and global backlash mounting, data suggests Trump's tariff blitz is straining the American economy, casting doubt on his promise to 'make it great again'.
Sensex opens 160 points higher, Nifty above 24,600; BEL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 229.73 points to 80,829.64, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 81.55 points to 24,646.90 as of 9:24 am.

JSW Cement IPO price band announced. Check other detailsJSW Cement's IPO includes a fresh issue of 10.88 crore shares worth Rs 1,600 crore and an offer for sale of 13.61 crore shares worth Rs 2,000 crore. The company had initially aimed to raise Rs 4,000 crore, but later reduced the issue size.

RBI MPC begins today: Will US tariffs trigger a rate cut?The RBI's August MPC is meeting after cutting interest rates by 100 basis points across its last three policy meetings. The policy stance has remained 'neutral'.

NSDL IPO allotment today: Check your status, GMP and listing dateInvestors who applied for NSDL shares can check their allotment status either on the BSE website or the website of the registrar, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime).

Personal loan for wedding? Why borrowing for the big day needs rethinkingA wedding is a beautiful milestone, but is it worth starting your new life under a mountain of debt? With the rising trend of using personal loans to fund lavish celebrations, it's time to rethink the cost of saying "I do."

Explained: Why India shouldn't lose sleep over Trump's 25% tariffsIndia shouldn't trade its future for short-term calm. Trump's tariff move is more noise than policy. Staying firm now will protect India's strength and choices in the long run.

entertainment.headline: Arbaaz Khan's wife Sshura flaunts baby bump for first time at his birthday bashActor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan's wife Sshura flaunted her baby bump at an event on Sunday. The couple made a stylish entry at Khan's birthday bash in Mumbai. The celebration was attended by several Bollywood celebrities, including actor Salman Khan.

John Abraham on working with Pakistani artistes: India comes first | ExclusiveActor John Abraham shared his strong views on putting India first before any cross-border artistic collaborations. He stressed national interests over personal or professional ties while promoting his film 'Tehran'.

Allu Arjun expresses pride as Indian dance group wows America's Got Talent judgesIndian dance group B Unique Crew delivered a sensational performance on the America's Got Talent stage, leaving both the judges and audience stunned. Actor Allu Arjun took a moment to express his pride in the group's achievement.

Juhi Chawla cheers for SRK's National Award, shares throwback pic and sweet noteShah Rukh Khan won his first-ever National Award for Best Actor for his performance in 'Jawan', sharing the honour with Vikrant Massey. Industry friends like Juhi Chawla, Suriya, and Mohanlal celebrated his win with heartfelt messages.

Kishore Kumar's wild journey: From flop auditions to Bollywood's singing GodKishore Kumar ruled the stage like a rock star, but his career began with rejection of his signature style that defied norms.

BTS reportedly records unreleased Michael Jackson track for upcoming tribute albumBTS have recorded a previously unreleased Michael Jackson track at Grouse Lodge studio in Ireland for a global tribute album. The project, supported by Jackson's Estate, will also feature a documentary on his time in Ireland.

Kingdom box office Day 4: Vijay Deverakonda's actioner crawls, earns Rs 40 croreDirector Gowtam Tinnanuri's espionage thriller 'Kingdom', starring Vijay Deverakonda, opened to a strong start but is now facing challenges in maintaining its box office momentum. The film's gripping plot and cliffhanger ending have generated curiosity.

Priyanka Chopra reaches Hyderabad with daughter Malti for SSMB 29 shoot amid strikePriyanka Chopra has returned to Hyderabad with her daughter to join the shoot of SS Rajamouli's upcoming film 'SSMB 29' starring Mahesh Babu. Meanwhile, the Telugu Film Industry Employees' Federation has called for a strike from August 4, halting film shoots over wage hike demands.

Chief of War review: Emotionally enriching and raw storytelling on war, destructionRelease Date:Fri Aug 01, 2025Chief of War review: 'Chief of War', available for streaming on Apple TV + is backed by actor Jason Mamoa. Is the epic-drama series worth your time? Here is our review.

Brag about me to me: SRK's playful request to wife Gauri after National Award winShah Rukh Khan's maiden National Award for Best Actor for 'Jawan' has sparked joyous family celebrations marked by heartfelt and witty exchanges on social media. He playfully asked his wife, Gauri Khan, to 'brag about him' at family dinner.

Adoor Gopalakrishnan's remark on women, SC filmmakers gets minister's counterLegendary filmmaker Adoor Gopalakrishnan stirred a row by saying that the Rs 1.5 crore funding being provided by Kerala to women directors could lead to corruption.

Telugu film shootings halted due to workers' strike demanding salary hikeFilm productions in the Telugu industry came to a halt from Monday, August 4. Telugu film workers called for a strike as employees demanded a 30 per cent pay rise.

SRK does a Shashi Tharoor while thanking politician for his National Award winShah Rukh Khan's National Award win for 'Jawan' prompted a witty exchange with Shashi Tharoor. This was SRK's first-ever National Award in 33 years of acting.

TV icon Loni Anderson dies at 79 after prolonged illnessLoni Anderson, beloved WKRP in Cincinnati star, died at 79 in Los Angeles after a long illness. She was known for her Emmy-nominated role and Hollywood legacy.

Dhanush slams AI version of Raanjhanaa, says 'stripped the film of its very soul'Dhanush criticised the unauthorised AI-altered re-release of Raanjhanaa and said the new ending removed the soul of the film and was released despite his objections, raising serious concerns about the use of artificial intelligence in creative work.

Mahavatar Narasimha continues unstoppable run, mints Rs 50 crore in HindiFilmmaker Ashwin Kumar's 'Mahavatar Narsimha', an animated film, is continuing to engage audiences in theatres despite stiff competition. The film hit the Rs 50 crore-mark nett in Hindi on its second Saturday at the box office.

Not just 2-part film, Ramayana is now available as an AI series'Ramayana' is being remade into a limited series using Artificial Intelligence (AI). The trailer for the series was released a few days ago and the first episode is now available for viewing.

Tamannaah on beauty procedures: Easy to judge people in media glareActor Tamannaah Bhatia opened up about beauty treatments amongst celebrities in the Indian film industry. In a conversation with The Lallantop, she said it is very easy to talk about people who are in the media glare.

Your harshest words sharpen me: Ajith Kumar to critics after 33 years in cinemaAjith Kumar marks 33 years in the film industry with gratitude and resilience. He shares insights on overcoming challenges in cinema and motor racing while thanking fans and family.

general news.headline: True Indian wouldn't...: Top court raps Rahul Gandhi over China claim, halts caseThe Supreme Court slammed Rahul Gandhi for his claim that China had annexed 2,000 km of Indian territory, but stayed defamation proceedings against him.

Voter IDs, Candyland chocolates, GPS: Trail of Pahalgam terrorists leads to PakFindings drawn from the post-encounter evidence released by security agencies establish beyond doubt that the Pahalgam terrorists were from Pakistan.

Curious case of the heavy roller: How it can affect Day 5 of the Oval TestThe Oval Test is set for a tense final day with England needing 35 runs and India requiring four wickets. The use of the heavy roller could influence the pitch, adding intrigue to the match's outcome.

'Where else can we feel safe?' MP's chain snatched in Delhi's diplomatic enclaveCongress MP R Sudha was injured in a chain-snatching incident near the Poland Embassy in Chanakyapuri. She described the incident as "highly shocking" given it occurred in the high-security diplomatic enclave of the capital.

Can Rahul's Babbar Sher Gaurav Gogoi win Assam from Himanta?By bringing in Gaurav Gogoi as its Assam unit president, the Congress is planning to put up a big fight against the BJP in the 2026 Assembly polls. Will the plan, with a definite Rahul Gandhi imprint, help the Congress win Assam from Himanta Biswa Sarma and BJP, or will it be just fireworks with little gain?

Shibu Soren, Jharkhand ex-Chief Minister and JMM founder, dies at 81Shibu Soren, former Jharkhand Chief Minister and JMM patriarch, died at 81 in a Delhi hospital on Monday after a prolonged illness, weeks after being admitted with a kidney-related ailment.

Fresh out of NDA, OPS rules out DMK tie-up, says Stalin meet was about healthAfter stepping away from the BJP-led  alliance in Tamil Nadu, O Panneerselvam has now strongly denied reports linking him to a potential tie-up with the ruling DMK. How India's native bananas are fighting colonial Cavendish with taste, nutritionThe British-origin Cavendish banana is invading markets across the world and has become the dominant variety sold everywhere. Even in India, Cavendish and its sub-varieties have gained territory, making native varieties like Bihar's Chinia and Assam's Bhimkol harder to spot. From Tamil Nadu to the Northeast, the native kadali phalams are putting up a tough fight. Will desi bananas be able to beat back the colonial Cavendish?

Joe Root backs England to win Oval Test: We have got what we need to cross lineEngland star Joe Root is backing the hosts to get over the finish line in the Oval Test and seal the series against India 3-1. Root scored his 39th Test century to put England on course for the win before a late twist got India back in the match.

India are in a position to win Oval Test: Varun Aaron's big claim before Day 5Former pacer Varun Aaron believes India can clinch victory in the Oval Test on Day 5. The match is evenly poised as England needed 35 runs and India is aiming to get four wickets.

A dramatic finale awaits, fitting for a series that has defied logic and thrilled at every turn.

Recognition of Siraj thrills bowling coach Morkel: His actions drive the groupIndia's bowling coach Morne Morkel said he was pleased that natural leader Mohammed Siraj was finally receiving the recognition he deserves, praising the pacer's unwavering commitment and consistency throughout the five-match Test series against England.

Lazy decision? Early stumps on Day 4 of Oval Test sparks debateOval Test: Play was called off early on Day 4 due to bad light and a passing shower. England needed 35 runs and India were pushing for four more wickets when wet weather pushed the fifth and final Test into Day 5.

Tired legs, aching body: Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj defy odds at OvalMohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna delivered exceptional bowling spells to revive India's chances in the final Test at The Oval. Their resilience sparked a thrilling comeback, stirring hope amid tough odds and intense pressure.

Jason Holder breaks Bravo's record to become highest wicket-taker for WI in T20IsJason Holder has broken Dwayne Bravo's record for most wickets in T20Is for West Indies after his match-winning performance against Pakistan in the second T20I.

Divya Deshmukh exclusive: Fearless chess, World Cup win, and India's surgeDivya Deshmukh recently created history by winning the Chess World Cup, becoming the youngest player and the first Indian to lift the title. The 19-year-old spoke to India Today about her success, style and the golden era of Indian chess.

Video: Son in tears as Spurs legend receives guard of honour in farewell gameAn emotional Son Heung-min was moved to tears as he bid farewell to Tottenham, in what is expected to have been his final outing in a Spurs shirt against Newcastle United.

Gill's performance in England better than my record of 774 runs: Sunil GavaskarLegendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar has rated Shubman Gill's performance in the ongoing series against England better than his debut series against West Indies in 1971.

Watch: AB de Villiers' aura farming dance during SA's WCL title celebrationAB de Villiers, at 41, gave cricket fans a masterclass in both performance and personality—first with a match-winning century, then with an 'aura-farming' celebration that lit up the internet.

Watch: Prasidh consoles Siraj after heartbreaking Harry Brook dropped catchEngland vs India, 5th Test: Mohammed Siraj stepped on the bodunary after taking a catch of Harry Brook in the first session on Day 4. Prasidh Krishna was distraught after Siraj's mistake.

Harry Maguire returns to United leadership as Amorim makes major changesAfter a chaotic season, Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim has reshaped the leadership structure, bringing back Harry Maguire and adding fresh voices like Noussair Mazraoui to guide a new-look squad toward redemption in 2025–26.

Ex-coach reveals secret behind KL Rahul's 500-run England Test seriesKL Rahul's standout showing in the Test series in England has drawn deserved praise, with former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar attributing it to the unwavering focus the batter displayed right after the IPL.

Pakistan cricket board announces blanket ban on future WCL participationThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) on Sunday, August 3, announced that they have introduced a blanket ban on future participation in the World Championship of Legends (WCL). The PCB said that they were unhappy with the conduct of the league during the 2025 edition.

5th Test Day 4 Highlights: Early stumps called, match set for Day 5 thrillerIndia vs England 5th Test Day 4 Highlights: A riveting phase of play comes to an unexpected end as both teams walk off the pitch due to poor light. The match will resume on Day 5 at the Oval, with England needing 35 runs, and India needing 4 wickets.

Murali Sreeshankar continues magical run after injury, secures 3rd straight titleMurali Sreeshankar secured his third consecutive title at the Qosanov Memorial Athletics Meet after returning from a knee injury. Sreeshankar is aiming to qualify for the World Athletics Championships in September.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
